item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1168/comment-page-1#comment-3349">Robert MacLean</a>.
Robert -- it doesn't seem to be that. My total screen resolution isn't listed. It's only the resolution for the "current" screen.
There is no meaningful resolution for multiple monitors other than a total number of pixels. Unless you have identical resolutions and exact alignment -- you might end up with dimensions that far exceed your monitors capabilities. (I have a 1920x1280 + 1280x1024 monitor). One sits lower than the other due to the stands. Further, I can't draw a bounding rectangle and compute a total screen resolution (especially since my primary monitor has more pixels in height than my secondary monitor).
